title: Understanding Cell References
text: In Excel, each cell is identified by a unique reference, such as B6 or B17. These references are used in formulas to perform calculations using the values in those cells.

title: Using the Subtraction Operator
text: To subtract one cell's value from another, use the minus sign $$(-)$$ between the two cell references. For example, to subtract the value in B17 from B6, you would write B6-B17.

title: Selecting the Correct Cell
text: First, select the cell where you want the result to appear. Which cell should you select?

title: Entering the Formula
text: After selecting the correct cell, enter the formula to subtract B17 from B6. What should the formula look like?

title: Finalizing the Formula
text: Once you've entered the formula, press Enter to calculate the result and display it in the selected cell.
